text: this is the bard the Four Seasons
restaurant in Manhattan and this is John
very a no a bartender there who not only
pours a decent little drink for his bar
patrons but also paints portraits of
some of them a practice that grew out of
his sketching them on cocktail napkins
here he is in his studio in Queens all
right so you're the painter of residents
of the four seasons indeed I am indeed I
am I mean I started these napkin
sketches just about a year after I got
there so I've been drawing these people
for many many many years the four
seasons is providing me with an infinite
amount of subject matter an incredible
amount of interesting people that I know
personally and a lot of them happen to
be very charismatic very buoyant and
catching the physiology the features
that's important of course to get a
likeness but what makes people so
fascinating are the intricacies that
make them up there complexities you know
whether it's there their charisma their
charm will kind of mood they're in it
there's a lot of enthusiasm for art at
our bar well you know we're dealing for
the most part with a pretty educated
clientele and a lot of these people have
an interest in the arts aside from
whatever their profession is for you
find people that share common interests
common ideas we can talk about anything
from ancient Greek mythology to what the
current events are and everything in
between and that makes it makes for a
very interesting environment but you
engage people and you and we get to know
each other rather quickly relationships
with people is paramount that's ninety
five percent of our job making the drink
is five percent
